Hello,

I'm working on the simulation of stabilized burner flame. So I use =

the demos "flame2.py". 
I have added a loop for varying the amount of CH4 =
in the 
composition. So I have some problem of integration.
To try to fix i=
t, I want to impose a pre converged solution at the 
beginning of the loop.=


I explain my idea:
The first loop computes the flame as it is writen with=
 "gas.setState
(tburner,p,comp)".
The other loop (n th loop)compute the fla=
me with the precedent 
composition and the precedent profile of temperature=
.

I have begin to modify the source code, but I have a problem with 
the t=
emperature argument of gas.setState. Why can I not impose the 
precedent pr=
ofile of temperature obtain with f.profile(f.flame,'T')?
Of course, I have =
impose the mesh with the precedent mesh.

Regards

David
